title: US defense chief orders all military to pause and review handling of extremism in ranks
description: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin has ordered a staggered pause of operations across the entire US military so commanders can have "needed discussions" with service members about the issue of extremism over the next 60 days, Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby announced on Wednesday.

title: World's first face and hands transplant gives New Jersey man a second chance at life
description: It's been more than two years since Joe Dimeo could smile.

title: 'He lost my vote': Trump supporter on lawmaker's impeachment vote
description: CNN's Kyung Lah speaks with Trump supporters in Washington state who say they feel betrayed after Rep. Dan Newhouse (R-WA) voted yes on the articles of impeachment of President Donald Trump.

title: Woman charged in Capitol riot asks judge to allow vacation in Mexico
description: A Texas woman charged in connection with the Capitol insurrection has asked a federal judge to let her travel to Mexico for a "work-related bonding retreat," according to court records.

title: 'Insane': See Kasich's reaction to McCarthy's move
description: Rep. Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) released a statement declining to remove Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) from her congressional committees despite promoting conspiracy theories about school shootings before she was elected. Former Republican Governor John Kasich discusses the move.

title: Archaeologists unearth Egyptian mummies with golden tongues
description: Archaeologists working at an Egyptian burial site have unearthed ancient mummies with golden tongues.

title: Inside the Capitol Police a month after the insurrection
Commercial pilots blame pandemic downtime for in-flight mistakes
description: Commercial pilots are blaming unprecedented downtime amid the coronavirus pandemic for in-flight mistakes made with passengers on board. CNN's Pete Mutean reports.

title: Why health experts are advising against Super Bowl parties
description: CNN's Erica Hill reports that health experts are strongly encouraging people to take precaution while watching the Super Bowl and avoid large gatherings.

title: Angelina Jolie's Winston Churchill painting could fetch $3.4M
description: Angelina Jolie is selling the only painting created by British Prime Minister Winston Churchill during World War II, with the work expected to fetch up to £2.5 million ($3.4 million) at auction.

title: Elon Musk admits Tesla has quality problems
description: Critics have slammed Tesla for Model 3 quality issues for years. And now CEO Elon Musk is admitting even his harshest critic was right.

title: Athletes at the Tokyo Olympics will not need a vaccine to participate
description: Athletes and officials will not be required to receive a Covid-19 vaccine in order to take part in this year's Tokyo Games, organizers announced on Wednesday.

title: Golden Globe nominations cast a light on the weirdness of this awards season
How Amazon can keep thriving even without Jeff Bezos
description: Jeff Bezos is stepping down as CEO of Amazon, but investors aren't too worried about the company's next steps.

title: I've had my Covid-19 vaccine -- now what can I safely do? Your questions answered
description: The day has finally come. You've received the second dose of a Covid-19 vaccine currently on the Western market -- Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech or Oxford-AstraZeneca.

title: Biden: No family members will be involved in any government decisions
description: President Joe Biden vowed that no one in his extended family will have sway over government decisions in an interview with People magazine published Wednesday.

title: Analysis: Oil companies face moment of truth. The stakes couldn't be higher
description: The climate crisis and the coronavirus pandemic are rapidly dividing the titans of the oil industry into two camps. There are big consequences depending on which side they choose.

title: UK variant mutation could be bad news for vaccines
How a South Carolina mom left QAnon behind
description: Ashley Vanderbilt fell down the QAnon rabbit hole. But after Joe Biden was inaugurated, she knew she'd been tricked. She tells CNN Business' Donie O'Sullivan how she escaped.

title: Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi remanded in custody following coup
description: Myanmar's deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi has been remanded in custody for two weeks, according to her party's spokesperson, two days after the country's powerful armed forces seized control in a coup.

title: Club World Cup: Al Ahly's 'Chosen One' coach draws strength from Nelson Mandela
description: He might be known as the "Pep Guardiola" of African football, but Al Ahly coach Pitso Mosimane's mantra is one coined by the iconic Nelson Mandela.

title: There are no Black execs at the top of Britain's biggest companies
description: The number of Black executives at the very top of the biggest companies on the London Stock Exchange has fallen to zero.

title: Kia stock soars on talk of Apple car deal
description: Kia Motors' stock just had its best day in more than two decades after news media in South Korea reported that it was closing in on a major deal with Apple.

title: British scientists say the next dangerous Covid variant is likely already out there. We just don't know it yet
description: Almost a month into a third nationwide lockdown, most of England seems to be in hibernation: stores are shuttered, high streets are deserted, and trains are almost empty. But in one small village in the countryside near Cambridge, in eastern England, there is a hive of activity.

title: China's big tech companies are now fighting with each other
description: As China sharpens its antitrust crackdown on the country's massive tech companies, two of the industry's biggest players are taking the fight to each other.

title: The Native American couple redefining relationship norms
description: In the summer of 2019, as an overcast sky hung over Minnesota's Prairie Island Indian Community, photographer and filmmaker Tomás Karmelo Amaya took a portrait of a couple kissing while wearing colorful regalia.

title: Inside a hospital dealing with a 'dramatic' second wave
description: A dramatic second wave of coronavirus is wreaking havoc in Colombia. Overworked health care professionals are feeling the crunch as the government recently announced its vaccination campaign will not start until the end of February. Journalist Stefano Pozzebon reports from Soacha, Colombia.

title: In this part of Australia the threat of a Covid outbreak has been superseded by a more imminent danger
Three skiers are missing after getting caught in a large avalanche in Colorado
description: Three skiers are missing after getting caught in a large avalanche between the Colorado towns of Silverton and Ophir, according to a preliminary report from the Colorado Avalanche Information Center.

title: How a garage filled with dusty old machines is helping South Africa combat Covid-19
description: At first glance, veteran ventilator technician and self-professed hoarder Robin Whittle looks like any other homeowner tinkering away in his two-car garage on a sunny afternoon in Durban -- surrounded by mounds of paper, and piles of plastic and metal parts.

title: Indian farmers vow to fight on after violent protest
description: Hundreds of thousands of farmers drove their tractors into New Delhi, as part of ongoing nationwide protests against controversial agricultural laws that farmers say put their livelihoods at risk. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

title: SpaceX Mars rocket prototype explodes on landing, again
description: Starship SN9, SpaceX's early prototype for a rocket the company hopes will carry the first humans to Mars, launched a high-altitude test flight Tuesday that saw the vehicle travel a few miles up in the air, hover for a moment, and then conduct a belly flop-like maneuver on descent before making an explosive landing back on the launch pad.

title: More than 100,000 people in the US have died of Covid-19 since January 1
description: More than 100,000 people have died from Covid-19 in the United States so far this year, according to Johns Hopkins University data.

title: WHO team heads to China bat lab at the center of coronavirus conspiracies
description: A team of World Health Organization investigators in Wuhan are visiting a laboratory Wednesday that has been the focus of conspiracies and speculation about the origin of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Trump powers GOP schism over Taylor Greene and Cheney
'We are lost:' Fox News suffers ratings slump while staffers fret about post-Trump future
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Biden looks to be in 'lockstep' with allies on China
description: The Biden administration wants to be "in lockstep" with allies and partners and then will engage with China, US State Department spokesperson Ned Price said Tuesday.

title: Several people were injured after a small explosion sparked a fire north of Los Angeles
description: Several people were injured Tuesday after a small explosion near a filming site in the hills north of Los Angeles sparked a fire, officials said.

title: Challenges for Liz Cheney and Margorie Taylor Greene show the battle between orthodox conservatives and pro-Trump radicals for control of the GOP
description: The Republican civil war hits a critical moment on Wednesday over the fate of two prominent lawmakers who represent rival visions for a party torn by the toxic but still powerful influence of Donald Trump.

title: Dr. Fauci on what is needed for society to 'get back to normal'
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci talks with Don Lemon about how many people need to be vaccinated against the coronavirus before society can "get back to normal."

title: House GOP weighs removing Greene from committees
description: Senate Republicans are losing patience with Georgia's new Republican congresswoman Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene.

title: Jeff Bezos is stepping down as Amazon CEO
description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos will step down from his role as chief executive later this year and transition to the role of executive chair, the company said Tuesday. He will be replaced by Andy Jassy, who currently heads the company's cloud business, Amazon Web Services.

title: George Conway: We're watching moral collapse of Republican Party
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper speaks with conservative lawyer George Conway about Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA), who has pushed continued claims of election fraud.

title: Amazon gets court to block $3.3 billion retail deal involving India's richest man
description: Amazon has been handed a major legal victory in its fight to block a multibillion-dollar deal between two of India's biggest retailers.

title: New York governor signs bill to repeal 'walking while trans' ban
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo signed a bill Tuesday repealing a controversial statute commonly known as the "walking while trans" ban.

title: Dance video goes viral as instructor seems oblivious to military
description: Coup? What coup? A fitness instructor dances while a military coup takes place behind her back. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Who is Alexey Navalny, Russia's outspoken Putin critic?
description: Anti-corruption activist, Kremlin critic and politician: Here's what you need to know about Alexey Navalny, one of the most prominent faces of opposition in Vladimir Putin's Russia.

title: Mickey Callaway, Angels pitching coach, accused of sexually inappropriate behavior
description: The Los Angeles Angels suspended pitching coach Mickey Callaway on Tuesday following a report by The Athletic alleging Callaway sent inappropriate pictures and unprompted texts to at least five female reporters over a span of at least five years.

title: CNN anchor: Greene's comment shook me
description: CNN's Erin Burnett takes a look at Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's (R-GA) conspiracy theories and how some House Republicans remain silent about her, but publicly bash Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) after she voted to impeach President Trump.
